channel.title: PHP Server?
channel.description: Would it be possible to write a server in PHP? Then you could get it hosted for nearly free on Free Web Hosts and What not.

item.title: PHP Server?
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“scriptingbybrian, post:9, topic:199909”]with ruby on rails is would be possible if you had years to devote, with php… no, I highly doubt its possible. particularly GUI type thigs, and every step would open a new $_GET function, so your url woudl be liek
www.xxxxxxxxx.xxx/client?x=----?y=---- , also it may include items as well, people could hack it with such ease… so php, no RoR maybe[/quote]A server does not need a GUI, and therefore it can be done. (Well, it can still have one, not too fancy though.)

Read full topic

item.title: PHP Server?
item.dc:creator: @scriptingbybrian scriptingbybrian
item.description:
@scriptingbybrian wrote:

with ruby on rails is would be possible if you had years to devote, with php… no, I highly doubt its possible. particularly GUI type thigs, and every step would open a new $_GET function, so your url woudl be liek
www.xxxxxxxxx.xxx/client?x=----?y=---- , also it may include items as well, people could hack it with such ease… so php, no RoR maybe

Read full topic

item.title: PHP Server?
item.dc:creator: @skiller_noob1 skiller noob1
item.description:
@skiller_noob1 wrote:

TeleNubby, you just owned him. And, I think they can be written in PHP.

Read full topic

item.title: PHP Server?
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

Since I know you’re going to look at this one more time:

[17:52] TeleNubby: lawl [17:52] TeleNubby: were you the one [17:52] TeleNubby: who told me a looong looong time ago [17:52] TeleNubby: a rs2 private server can be written w/ php and other things? [17:52] lawl: no TeleNubby [17:52] _cake: telenubby: ye, anything that has networking support [17:52] lawl: but it can shore
That was about.. 2 minutes before this post.

Read full topic

item.title: PHP Server?
item.dc:creator: @Stanyer Stanyer
item.description:
@Stanyer wrote:

[quote=“TeleNubby, post:5, topic:199909”][quote author=Stanyer link=topic=264577.msg2187394#msg2187394 date=1208230713]

[quote author=TeleNubby link=topic=264577.msg2187378#msg2187378 date=1208230579]

of course not
[/quote]Actually, it is. It’d just be time-consuming and difficult unless you are quite experienced with PHP. It’s also a dirty way to do it for free 24/7, as your host would simply notice the excess amount of connections to that address and what you are sending back and forth. So in the end, all that time wasted would not be worth it.

You do realise,

It would be impossible to program a server in complete php.

PHP has nowhere near enough functions to create a multi-user game such as runescape.
[/quote]I’ve talked to a few people in my time here. It CAN be done. Even if it isnt just PHP, an average/“good enough” webhost can have other features that will allow you to do it.[/quote]

I’m not going to argue, i’ve had 2 years experience in php programming and i’m telling you a server could never be done with a standalone php project, even if it was assisted with these ‘other features’ you talk of.

/Out of this thread.

Read full topic
